summary: PED causes the death of newborn piglets and weight loss in pigs of all ages from PEDV-induced severe symptoms, such as severe diarrhea, vomiting, and dehydration. PEDV can be divided into genotypes G1 and G2 based on phylogenetic analysis of full-length S gene sequences. shRNAs are exported from the nucleus by exportin-5 and processed by the RNase III Dicer into small double-stranded RNA molecules of 19 to 23 bp called siRNAs. RNAi evolves in the host defense system directed at infectious viruses and transposable elements. effective silencing of transgene expression and endogenous genes in vivo was shown by a number of groups. all three shRNAs effectively inhibited PEDV replication and N expression of the G1 and G2 subtypes. primary intestinal epithelial cells were isolated by the tissue explant adherent method and purified by trypsin digestion with citric acid. the PEDV G1 CV777 vaccine strain was isolated in vero E6 cells. cultures were cultured and used to amplify PEDV as previously described. control shRNA was designed at the same time to have no homology with PEDV or the IEC cell genome. all sequences were arranged as BbsI + sense + loop + antisense + termination signal + BamHI. expression of siRNAs was driven by the U6 promoter. IEC cells were seeded into 12-well plates at 5 104 cells per well without antibiotics and grown at 37 °C overnight with 5% CO2. the 60–80% confluent cells were transiently transfected with the indicated plasmid using Lipofectamine 3000. Membranes were washed twice in Tris-buffered saline (TBS) and incubated 2 h in Superblock blocking buffer (ThermoFisher, Waltham, MA, USA) membranes were visualized using an Odyssey infrared imaging system. immunofluorescence assays IEC cells were seeded in 12-well plates. confluent cell monolayers were transfected with shR-N307, shR-N463 and shR-N1071, or shR-NC (4 g) with Lipofectamine 3000 (Invitrogen) before PEDV infection. primary intestinal epithelial cells were isolated by the tissue explant adherent method and purified by trypsin digestion with citric acid. cell culture media were changed every two days, and cells were passaged every 3–4 days by trypsinization with 0.25% trypsin–ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (EDTA) topathic effects (CPEs) were collected for three freeze–thaw cycles. cultures were 10-fold serially diluted with virus replication medium containing trypsin (10 g/mL) the inocula were removed and cells were inoculated at 0.1 mL per well into each well. shRNA-expressing plasmids shR-N307, shR-N463, shR-N1071 and shR-NC. expression of siRNAs was driven by the U6 promoter. plasmids shR-N307, shR-N463, and shR-N1071 indicate initial shRNA target sites. IEC cells were transfected with or without 1 g, 2 g, or 4 of g shR-N307, shR-N463, and shR-N1071 or 4 g of shR-NC for 24 h. at 48 h post-infection, antigen slides were prepared to detect PEDV N expression. membranes were incubated with anti-N monoclonal antibody (mAb) 3G2 (prepared by our laboratory, diluted 1:1000), anti-myc monoclonal (Sigma, diluted 1:1000) or anti-glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate dehydrogenase (GAPDH) monoclonal antibody (Sigma, diluted 1:10,000) cells were fixed with 4% paraformaldehyde at 4 °C for 30 min. fixed cells were permeabilized with 0.2% Triton X-100 for 15 min. preparations were labeled with the mouse anti-PEDV N mAb (1:100 dilution) for 2 h. Inoculation of CV777 and LNCT2 with IEC cells resulted in positive immunofluorescent staining with mAb that recognized the virus N protein. controls were negative for immunostaining. we used the N gene of LNCT2 as the target sequence. the sites were at +307 to +327 nt, +463 to +483 nt, and +1071 to +1091 nt relative to the 5′ ATG initiation codon. absorption at 450 nm was recorded and expressed as a percentage of relative cell viability. significant differences were assessed by Student’s t-test; ns, no significant difference compared to control; p > 0.05. p value was calculated using Student’s t-test. shR-N307, shR-N463, and shR-N1071 influence on pAcGFP-N expression in cultured IEC cells. PMyc-N was co-transfected with increasing doses of shR-N307, shR-N463, or shR-N1071 into IEC cells. after 48 h, transfected cells were lysed. pAcGFP-N was fused with the AcGFP gene to make pAcGFP-N. at 48 h post-transfection, the effects of shRNA on enhanced GFP expression were monitored by fluorescence microscopy. the shR-N307, shR-N463, and shR-N1071 expression cassettes targeting the N gene inhibited the expression of AcGFP to some extent compared with cells transfected with plasmid p the inhibitory effects of the three shRNAs on N expression were elevated with increased shRNA concentration. these results show that N-targeted shRNA efficiently inhibited target gene expression during PEDV replication in infected IEC cells. p value was calculated using Student’s t-test; (B) PEDV LNCT2 titers in shRNA-transfected IEC cells were determined using the Reed–Muench method. errors represent standard errors of the mean from three independent experiments. MERS-CoV and PEDV infect epithelial cells in the respiratory and/or enteric tracts. the control of coronavirus diseases is important for human public health security. further developing RNAi as a potential therapeutic agent is worthwhile. shRNA expression did not affect the viability of IEC cells. shRNAs shR-N307, shR-N463, and shR-N1071 strongly reduced GFP expression. recombinant lentiviruses express shRNAs efficiently and stably. plasmids expressing three shRNAs targeting different sites of the N gene of PEDV were constructed and transfected into IEC cells. the results showed that PEDV G1 and G2 strains were susceptible to RNAi pathways targeting the N gene.
